get.summary: Retrieves the program of study with the specified ID.
get.description: Retrieves information about the Program of Study with the specified ID, as of the specified effective date. If you don't specify the effectiveDate query parameter, the effective date defaults to the current date. Secured by: Manage: Program of Study Scope: Academic Foundation

parameters.name: ID
parameters.description: The Workday ID of the resource.

200.description: Successful response. A successful response can return no matched data.

get.summary: Retrieves the Academic Unit with the specified ID.
get.description: Retrieves information about the Academic Unit with the specified ID, as of the specified effective date. If you don't specify the effectiveDate query parameter, the effective date defaults to the current date. Secured by: Reports: Academic Units, Set Up: Academic Unit Configuration, Set Up: Academic Units Scope: Academic Faculty, Academic Foundation

parameters.name: ID
parameters.description: The Workday ID of the resource.

200.description: Successful response. A successful response can return no matched data.

get.summary: Retrieves the academic year associated with an academic calendar with the specified ID.
get.description: Retrieves the academic year associated with the specified academic calendar ID with the specified ID. Secured by: Set Up: Academic Calendar Scope: Academic Foundation

parameters.name: ID
parameters.description: The Workday ID of the resource.

parameters.name: subresourceID
parameters.description: The Workday ID of the subresource.

200.description: Successful response. A successful response can return no matched data.

get.summary: Retrieves a collection of educational credentials.
get.description: Retrieves all educational credentials. Secured by: Set Up: Academic Structure Scope: Academic Foundation

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: The maximum number of objects in a single response. The default is 20. The maximum is 100.

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: The zero-based index of the first object in a response collection. The default is 0. Use offset with the limit parameter to control paging of a response collection. Example: If limit is 5 and offset is 9, the response returns a collection of 5 objects starting with the 10th object.

200.description: Successful response. A successful response can return no matched data.

get.summary: Retrieves a collection of academic units.
get.description: Retrieves all academic units. You can filter the academic units by effective date, inactive status, institutional status, and their immediate superior. Secured by: Reports: Academic Units, Set Up: Academic Unit Configuration, Set Up: Academic Units Scope: Academic Faculty, Academic Foundation

parameters.name: effectiveDate
parameters.description: The effective date of the Academic Unit, using the yyyy-mm-dd format. The default is the current date.

parameters.name: inactive
parameters.description: If true, this method retrieves Academic Units that are inactive as of the effective date. The default is false.

parameters.name: institution
parameters.description: If true, this method retrieves Academic Units that are designated as institutions as of the effective date. The default is false.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: The maximum number of objects in a single response. The default is 20. The maximum is 100.

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: The zero-based index of the first object in a response collection. The default is 0. Use offset with the limit parameter to control paging of a response collection. Example: If limit is 5 and offset is 9, the response returns a collection of 5 objects starting with the 10th object.

parameters.name: superior
parameters.description: The Workday ID of the immediate superior of the Academic Units, as of the effective date. You can use a returned id from GET /academicUnits.

200.description: Successful response. A successful response can return no matched data.

get.summary: Retrieves a collection of academic levels.
get.description: Retrieves all academic levels. Secured by: Set Up: Academic Structure Scope: Academic Foundation

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: The maximum number of objects in a single response. The default is 20. The maximum is 100.

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: The zero-based index of the first object in a response collection. The default is 0. Use offset with the limit parameter to control paging of a response collection. Example: If limit is 5 and offset is 9, the response returns a collection of 5 objects starting with the 10th object.

200.description: Successful response. A successful response can return no matched data.

get.summary: Retrieves a collection of programs of study.
get.description: Retrieves all Programs of Study. You can filter the Programs of Study by effective date, academic unit, academic level, program type, CIP code, or educational credential. Secured by: Manage: Program of Study Scope: Academic Foundation

parameters.name: academicLevel
parameters.description: The Workday ID of the owning academic level of the program of study, as of the effective date. You can use a return id from GET /academicLevels

parameters.name: academicUnit
parameters.description: The Workday ID of the owning academic unit of the program of study, as of the effective date. You can use a return id from GET /academicUnits

parameters.name: cipCode
parameters.description: The Workday ID of the CIP code for the program of study, as of the effective date.

parameters.name: educationalCredentials
parameters.description:
The Workday IDs of the educational credentials of the program of study, as of the effective date. You can use the return id from GET /educationalCredentials. 

You can filter programs of study by multiple educational credentials. Example: educationalCredentials=A&educationalCredentials=B&educationalCredentials=C. In this example, the method returns programs of study that have credentials A, B, AND C as of the the effectiveDate or current date.

parameters.name: effectiveDate
parameters.description: The effective date of the Program of Study, using the yyyy-mm-dd format. The default is the current date.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: The maximum number of objects in a single response. The default is 20. The maximum is 100.

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: The zero-based index of the first object in a response collection. The default is 0. Use offset with the limit parameter to control paging of a response collection. Example: If limit is 5 and offset is 9, the response returns a collection of 5 objects starting with the 10th object.

parameters.name: programType
parameters.description: The Workday ID of the program type of the program of study, as of the effective date.

200.description: Successful response. A successful response can return no matched data.

get.summary: Retrieves a collection of academic periods.
get.description: Retrieves all academic periods. You can filter the academic periods by the academic calendar, academic year, start date, and end date. Secured by: Set Up: Academic Appointments and Related Data, Set Up: Academic Calendar Scope: Academic Faculty, Academic Foundation

parameters.name: academicCalendar
parameters.description: The Workday ID of the academic calendar for the academic period. You can use a return id from GET /academicCalendars

parameters.name: academicYear
parameters.description: The Workday ID of the academic year for the academic period. You can use a return id from GET /academicCalendars/{ID}/academicYears

parameters.name: fromDate
parameters.description: Filter academic periods by their start date using yyyy-mm-dd format. If used without toDate, returns all academic periods with start date on or after fromDate. If used with toDate, returns all academic periods whose start and/or end dates are within the inclusive date range specified by fromDate and toDate.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: The maximum number of objects in a single response. The default is 20. The maximum is 100.

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: The zero-based index of the first object in a response collection. The default is 0. Use offset with the limit parameter to control paging of a response collection. Example: If limit is 5 and offset is 9, the response returns a collection of 5 objects starting with the 10th object.

parameters.name: toDate
parameters.description: Filter academic periods by their end date using yyyy-mm-dd format. If used without fromDate, returns all academic periods with end date on or before toDate. If used with fromDate, returns all academic periods whose start and/or end dates are within the inclusive date range specified by fromDate and toDate.

200.description: Successful response. A successful response can return no matched data.

field.description: The field related to the error

path.description: The path of the field related to the error
